case_vignette:
A 55-year-old man presents with bloody nasal secretions and shortness of breath. He reports he has lost 4 kg (8.8 lb) in the last two months with no changes in his diet. He has also been suffering from mild to moderate joint pain in the left knee for the last year. His past medical history is unremarkable. His vitals include: blood pressure 120/70 mm Hg, temperature 37.0℃ (98.6℉), pulse 70/min, respiratory rate 14/min. Physical examination is significant for nasal ulcers. Diffuse crackles are present over all lobes of the lung bilaterally. Laboratory findings are significant for the following:
Hemoglobin 12.9 g/dL
Hematocrit 37.7%
Leukocyte count 5500/mm3
Neutrophils 65%
Lymphocytes 30%
Monocytes 5%
Mean corpuscular volume 82.2 μm3
Platelet count 190,000/mm3
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 35 mm/h
C-reactive protein 14 mg/dL
Creatinine 3.09 mg/dL
The patient is prescribed a corticosteroid nasal spray and oral antibiotics but returns in 2 weeks without any clinical improvement.
question: Which  would most likely confirm the diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having bloody nasal secretions and I'm short of breath.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms for the last two months.
Do you have any joint pain or swelling?
Yes, I've been suffering from mild to moderate joint pain in my left knee for the last year.
Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?
No, my past medical history is unremarkable.
Do you take any medications or supplements regularly? If so, what are they?
I don't take any regular medications or supplements.
Is there a family history of autoimmune diseases or any other relevant medical conditions?
I don't know of any family history of autoimmune diseases or other relevant medical conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Rheumatoid Arthritis

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient presents to the clinic with complaints of bloody nasal secretions and shortness of breath that have been ongoing for the last two months. The patient also mentions suffering from mild to moderate joint pain in the left knee for the last year. The patient denies any significant past medical history, regular medication or supplement use, as well as any family history of autoimmune diseases or other relevant medical conditions.
